Application_Facts: Mr. Ahmed claimed persecution in Pakistan due to his Shia identity and involvement with Anjuman Hussainia
Decision_Outcome: Board rejected refugee claim based on credibility concerns
Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review allowed; case referred back for re-hearing before a different panel
Defendant_Behavior: Board questioned credibility, noted contradictions, lack of evidence, implausible explanations
Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution based on religion and association
Credibility_Assessment: Found not credible due to contradictions, lack of business evidence, implausible explanations
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution on religious and associational grounds
Governing_Rule: Patent unreasonableness standard applies to factual and credibility findings
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of documentary proof for business activities
Harm_Assessment: Risk of return to persecution in Pakistan
Cause_Description: Persecution due to Shia faith and organizational affiliation
Evidence_Handling: Board failed to properly consider corroborative letter
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 97(1) of IRPA â€“ failure to fairly assess credibility and evidence
Decision_Rationale: Findings were patently unreasonable due to errors in fact and credibility assessment
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to account for exculpatory or supporting evidence
